enum.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT
enum.description: Micro air vehicle / autopilot classes. This identifies the individual model.

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC
entry.description: Generic autopilot, full support for everything

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_ONLY
entry.description: Generic autopilot only supporting simple waypoints

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_AND_SIMPLE_NAVIGATION_ONLY
entry.description: Generic autopilot supporting waypoints and other simple navigation commands

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_MISSION_FULL
entry.description: Generic autopilot supporting the full mission command set

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_INVALID
entry.description: No valid autopilot, e.g. a GCS or other MAVLink component

enum.name: MAV_TYPE
enum.description: MAVLINK component type reported in HEARTBEAT message. Flight controllers must report the type of the vehicle on which they are mounted (e.g. MAV_TYPE_OCTOROTOR). All other components must report a value appropriate for their type (e.g. a camera must use MAV_TYPE_CAMERA).

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_GCS
entry.description: Operator control unit / ground control station

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_DUOROTOR
entry.description: Two-rotor VTOL using control surfaces in vertical operation in addition. Tailsitter.

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_QUADROTOR
entry.description: Quad-rotor VTOL using a V-shaped quad config in vertical operation. Tailsitter.

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode the MAV mode.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED
entry.description: 0b10000000 MAV safety set to armed. Motors are enabled / running / can start. Ready to fly. Additional note: this flag is to be ignore when sent in the command MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE and MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM shall be used instead. The flag can still be used to report the armed state.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_HIL_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00100000 hardware in the loop simulation. All motors / actuators are blocked, but internal software is full operational.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00010000 system stabilizes electronically its attitude (and optionally position). It needs however further control inputs to move around.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00001000 guided mode enabled, system flies waypoints / mission items.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_AUTO_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000100 autonomous mode enabled, system finds its own goal positions. Guided flag can be set or not, depends on the actual implementation.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_TEST_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000010 system has a test mode enabled. This flag is intended for temporary system tests and should not be used for stable implementations.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CALIBRATING
entry.description: System is calibrating and not flight-ready.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_STANDBY
entry.description: System is grounded and on standby. It can be launched any time.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_ACTIVE
entry.description: System is active and might be already airborne. Motors are engaged.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CRITICAL
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It can however still navigate.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It lost control over parts or over the whole airframe. It is in mayday and going down.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_POWEROFF
entry.description: System just initialized its power-down sequence, will shut down now.

message.name: HEARTBEAT
message.description: The heartbeat message shows that a system or component is present and responding. The type and autopilot fields (along with the message component id), allow the receiving system to treat further messages from this system appropriately (e.g. by laying out the user interface based on the autopilot). This microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/heartbeat.html
message.field: Vehicle or component type. For a flight controller component the vehicle type (quadrotor, helicopter, etc.). For other components the component type (e.g. camera, gimbal, etc.). This should be used in preference to component id for identifying the component type.
Autopilot type / class. Use MAV_AUTOPILOT_INVALID for components that are not flight controllers.
A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags
MAVLink version, not writable by user, gets added by protocol because of magic data type: uint8_t_mavlink_version
